Package com.bewsoftware.utils.graphics

Class ImageTools

java.lang.Object
com.bewsoftware.utils.graphics.ImageTools
public class ImageTools extends Object
This class contains various static helper methods related to the manipulation of graphic images.
Note:
The code or ideas for these methods came mostly from the effort/work of others on the Internet. Recognition of their individual effort is primarily given in the JavaDoc comments attached to each method. This is usually in the form a link to the website page that was the source of the code/information.
Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Bradley Willcott

  • Method Details

    • createImageIcon

      public static <T> ImageIcon createImageIcon(Class<T> t, String path, String description)
      Returns an ImageIcon, or null if the path was invalid.

      Example:

      
     ImageIcon icon = createImageIcon(MyClass.class, "images/MyIcon.png", "My favourite picture");
      Method code sourced from : Java Tutorials Code Sample – IconDemoApp.java

      Modified the code to add the new first parameter: t. This allows the code to be further modified, making it into a static method of an external library class.

      Type Parameters:
      T - class type of the calling instance.
      Parameters:
      t - Usually should be the calling class, such as: MyClass.class.
      path - Image file path.
      description - of icon.
      Returns:
      new icon, or null if not found.

    • getScaledImage

      public static Image getScaledImage(Image srcImg, int scaledWidth, int scaledHeight, boolean preserveAlpha, boolean preserveRatio)
      Resizes an image using a Graphics2D object backed by a BufferedImage.

      Method code sourced from: Java Tutorials Code Sample – IconDemoApp.java

      This code has been modified to incorporate code from: ExceptionsHub.com - Java image resize, maintain aspect ratio
      Added preservation of aspect ratio, and changed the parameter names for w and h.

      Further modification ideas came from: How can I resize an image using Java? and How to resize an image in Java ?
      Added Alpha preservation and additional RenderingHints.

      Parameters:
      srcImg - source image to scale
      scaledWidth - desired width
      scaledHeight - desired height
      preserveAlpha - Preserve Alpha - image with 8-bit RGBA color components
      preserveRatio - Preserve aspect ratio?
      Returns:
      - the new resized image

    • getFasterScaledInstance

      public static BufferedImage getFasterScaledInstance(BufferedImage img, int targetWidth, int targetHeight, boolean progressiveBilinear)
      The fastest way to scale an image in java without losing image quality is to use Bilinear scaling. Bilinear is only good if you scale the image by 50% at a time because of the way it works. The following code is from "Filthy rich clients" by Chet Haase. He explains multiple techniques in the book, but this one has the highest performance to quality trade-off.

      It supports all types of BufferedImages so don't worry about compatibility. It also lets java2D hardware accelerate your image because the calculations are done by Java2D. Don't worry if you don't understand that last part. The most important thing is that this is the fastest way to do it.

      Method code and the above comments were sourced from: Stack Overflow - How to improve the performance of g.drawImage() method for resizing images

      Parameters:
      img - Source image.
      targetWidth - Target width.
      targetHeight - Target height.
      progressiveBilinear - Use Progressive Bilinear?
      Returns:
      the scaled image.
